locale.message: The OA-S plugin transforms OJS into a data provider for the Open Access Statistics (OA-S) project.
This plugin implements reports based on OA-S metrics.
You successfully opted out from usage statistics collection. While you see this message no statistics will be collected from your usage of this site. Click the below button to revert your decision.
We log anonymous usage statistics. Please read the privacy information for details.

If you click the opt-out button below then your browser will receive an "opt-out cookie" and no statistics information will be collected at all as long as this cookie is present in your browser. The opt-out information will be stored for one year and will be renewed for another year whenever you access OJS. The cookie contains no information that may be used to identify you. Please note that if you are using a different browser or if you delete cookies from your browser then you'll have to opt-out again as we'll not keep any personal information about you on our side to protect your privacy.

You have got two options to download aggregate statistics from the OA-S server: You can either set up a cronjob (see README in the plugin directory) or update statistics manually by clicking the button below.
Please provide a password to prevent unauthorized access to your raw statistics data.
Please enter a password that protects your statistics data from unauthorized access.

Your usage statistics will be transferred to OA-S via a so-called "OAI-PMH" interface. You have to protect that interface from unauthorized access by setting a self-chosen password. This is necessary to guarantee your users' privacy. When registering to participate in the OA-S system you'll have to provide this password so that the OA-S server can retrieve your statistics data. The corresponding username 'ojs-oas' is fixed in OJS. Please use the username 'ojs-oas' together with your password to register for OA-S.
Please enter the OA-S statistics server password.
Please enter a valid password to authenticate to the OA-S statistics server.
Please enter the OA-S statistics server URL you received from the OA-S project (example: https://oase.gbv.de/ojs-test/).
Please enter a valid OA-S statistics server URL (example: https://oase.gbv.de/ojs-test/).
Please enter the OA-S statistics server username you received from the OA-S project.
Please enter a valid username to authenticate to the OA-S statistics server (colons are disallowed).

Consolidated and cleansed usage statistics will be automatically be downloaded from the OA-S statistics server. Once you registered to participate in the OA-S project, you'll receive a username and password to access that statistics server. Please enter these credentials here.

Transferring statistics data to OA-S may have direct or indirect implications for your users' privacy. Please check whether you are liable to provide a privacy message to your end users. Notwithstanding other legislation this is usually the case if you have to comply with German privacy legislation. This message will appear when users click on the "privacy information" link that automatically comes with this plug-in.

The OA-S plugin requires access to a SALT server to pseudonimize IP addresses. After registering your OJS installation with the OA-S project you'll receive a username and password from University Library Saarbrücken (SULB). Please enter these login credentials here so that you are able to use the plug-in.
Please enter the corresponding SALT server password.
Please enter a valid password to authenticate to the SALT server.
Please enter the OA-S SALT server username you received from University Saarbrücken.
Please enter a valid username to authenticate to the SALT server (colons are disallowed).
